activities: DICOM Grid facilitates the exchange and storage of medical imaging materials through a web-based software program. Currently, DICOM Grid processes de-identified DICOMs from clinical trial sites in the EU/EEA and Switzerland.  In the future, we hope to have customers in the EU/EEA and Switzerland who store and exchange DICOMs that have not been de-identified.  Personal data associated with medical images that DICOM Grid receives from the EU/EEA is only collected with the permission of the individual, and is used only for the purpose of said exchange and storage. Personal information received by DICOM Grid is never sold, rented, or shared without the explicit consent of the individual.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, United Kingdom
personaldata: Employee data including first name, last name, and email address.  Patient data including protected health information that is part of a DICOM.  Clinical trial data, but please note that the protected health information is de-identified locally before leaving the sending computer.  Although we transport DICOMs for clinical trials, PHI is removed/de-identified prior to transport.
